00020 
00021 #ifndef VECTOR_H_
00022 #define VECTOR_H_
00023 
00024 #include "Array.h"
00025 #include "Collection.h"
00026 #include "Util.h"
00027 #include "Equals.h"
00028 #include "Iterator.h"
00029 
00030 #include <vector>
00031 #include <initializer_list>
00032 
00033 SYLPH_BEGIN_NAMESPACE
00034 
00035 SYLPH_PUBLIC
00036 
00037 template<class T>
00038 class Vector : public Collection<T> {
00039 public:
00040     class iterator : public RandomAccessIterator<T, iterator> {
00041     public:
00042         typedef RandomAccessIterator<T, iterator> super;
00043 
00044         iterator(bool begin = false, Vector<T>* obj = NULL)
00045         : super(begin), _obj(obj) {
00046             _currentIndex = begin ? 0 : _obj->size();
00047         }
00048 
00049         iterator(bool begin = false, const Vector<T>* obj = NULL)
00050         : super(begin), _obj(const_cast<Vector<T>*> (obj)) {
00051             _currentIndex = begin ? 0 : _obj->size();
00052         }
00053 
00054         bool equals(const iterator& other) const {
00055             return _currentIndex == other._currentIndex &&
00056                     _obj == other._obj;
00057         }
00058 
00059         iterator(const iterator& other) {
00060             _currentIndex = other._currentIndex;
00061             _obj = other._obj;
00062         }
00063 
00064         typename super::reference current() const {
00065             return (*_obj)[_currentIndex];
00066         }
00067 
00068         bool hasNext() const {
00069             return _currentIndex < _obj->size();
00070         }
00071 
00072         void next() const {
00073             _currentIndex++;
00074         }
00075 
00076         bool hasPrevious() const {
00077             return _currentIndex >= 0;
00078         }
00079 
00080         void previous() const {
00081             _currentIndex--;
00082         }
00083 
00084         idx_t currentIndex() const {
00085             return _currentIndex;
00086         }
00087 
00088         size_t length() const {
00089             return _obj->size();
00090         }
00091     private:
00092         mutable idx_t _currentIndex;
00093         Vector<T>* _obj;
00094     };
00095     S_ITERABLE(T)
00096 public:
00097 
00098     explicit Vector(std::size_t initialCount = 16, std::size_t increase = 0) :
00099         elements((std::size_t)initialCount), capacityIncrease(increase),
00100         elementCount(0) {
00101     }
00102 
00103     Vector(const Vector<T> & orig) :
00104             elements((std::size_t)orig.elements->length),
00105             capacityIncrease(orig.capacityIncrease),
00106             elementCount(orig.elementCount) {
00107         arraycopy(orig.elements, 0, elements, 0, orig.elements.length);
00108     }
00109 
00110     Vector(const Array<T> & orig) : elements((size_t)orig.length << 1),
00111             elementCount(orig.length), capacityIncrease(0){
00112         arraycopy(orig, 0, elements, 0, orig.length);
00113     }
00114 
00115     Vector(const std::initializer_list<T> & orig) : elements(orig.size() << 1),
00116             capacityIncrease(0), elementCount(0){
00117         for (T * t = orig.begin(); t < orig.end(); t++) {
00118             this->push(&t);
00119         }
00120     }
00121 
00122     virtual ~Vector() {}
00123 
00124     // vector specific
00125     void push(const T & t) {
00126         add(t);
00127     }
00128 
00129     T pop() {
00130         T toReturn = elements[elementCount - 1];
00131         elementCount--;
00132         return toReturn;
00133     }
00134 
00135     T & get(std::size_t idx) {
00136         if (idx >= elementCount) sthrow(ArrayException, "Vector out of bounds");
00137         else {
00138             return elements[idx];
00139         }
00140     }
00141 
00142     const T & get(std::size_t idx) const {
00143         if (idx >= elementCount) sthrow(ArrayException, "Vector out of bounds");
00144         else {
00145             return elements[idx];
00146         }
00147     }
00148 
00149     void set(std::size_t idx, const T & t) {
00150         if (idx >= elementCount) sthrow(ArrayException, "Vector out of bounds");
00151         else {
00152             elements[idx] = t;
00153         }
00154     }
00155 
00156     void trim() {
00157         Array<T> oldElements = elements;
00158         elements = Array<T>(elementCount);
00159         arraycopy(oldElements, 0, elements, 0, elementCount);
00160     }
00161 
00162     bool add(const T & t) {
00163         ensureCapacity(elementCount + 1);
00164         elements[elementCount] = t;
00165         elementCount++;
00166         return true;
00167     }
00168 
00169     bool addAll(const Collection<T> & c) {
00170     Array<T> ar = c.toArray();
00171     sforeach(T& t, ar) {
00172             this->add(t);
00173         }
00174         return true;
00175     }
00176 
00177     void clear() {
00178         elementCount = 0;
00179         elements.clear();
00180     }
00181 
00182     bool contains(T & t) const {
00183         return indexOf(t) != -1;
00184     }
00185 
00186     bool containsAll(const Collection<T> & c) const {
00187         std::size_t amount = 0;
00188 
00189         sforeach(T & t, c) {
00190             if (this->contains(t)) amount++;
00191         }
00192         return amount == c.size();
00193     }
00194 
00195     bool operator==(const Collection<T> & c) const {
00196         Vector * v = dynamic_cast<Vector> (c);
00197         if (v == NULL) return false;
00198         else if (this->size() != c.size()) return false;
00199         else {
00200             for (std::size_t x = 0; x < c.size(); x++) {
00201                 if (*this[x] != c[x]) return false;
00202             }
00203             return true;
00204         }
00205     }
00206 
00207     bool empty() const {
00208         return size() == 0;
00209     }
00210     virtual Collection<T> filter(typename Collection<T>::FilterFunction func,
00211       Any& clientData) {
00212         Vector<T> toReturn;
00213         for(idx_t i = 0; i < size(); i++) {
00214             if(func((*this)[i],clientData)) toReturn.push((*this)[i]);
00215         }
00216         return toReturn;
00217     }
00218 
00219     bool remove(const T & t) {
00220         bool b;
00221         (b = indexOf(t) != -1) && removeAt(indexOf(t));
00222         return b;
00223     }
00224 
00225     void removeAt(std::size_t idx) {
00226         if (idx > size()) sthrow(ArrayException, "Vector out of bounds");
00227         elementCount--;
00228         if (idx < elementCount)
00229             arraycopy(elements, idx + 1, elements, idx,
00230                 elementCount - idx);
00231     }
00232 
00233     bool removeAll(const Collection<T> & c) {
00234         std::size_t i;
00235         std::size_t j;
00236         for (i = 0; i < elementCount; i++) {
00237             if (c.contains(elements[i])) break;
00238         }
00239         if (i == elementCount) return false;
00240 
00241         for (j = i++; i < elementCount; i++) {
00242             if (!c.contains(elements[i])) elements[j++] = elements[i];
00243         }
00244         elementCount -= i - j;
00245         return true;
00246     }
00247 
00248     bool retainAll(const Collection<T> & c) {
00249         std::size_t i;
00250         std::size_t j;
00251         for (i = 0; i < elementCount; i++) {
00252             if (!c.contains(elements[i])) break;
00253         }
00254         if (i == elementCount) return false;
00255 
00256         for (j = i++; i < elementCount; i++) {
00257             if (c.contains(elements[i])) elements[j++] = elements[i];
00258         }
00259         elementCount -= i - j;
00260         return true;
00261     }
00262 
00263     std::size_t size() const {
00264         return elementCount;
00265     }
00266 
00267     Array<T> toArray() const {
00268         return elements;
00269     }
00270 
00271     // vector specific non-destructive
00272 
00273     T& front() {
00274         return elements[0];
00275     }
00276     const T & front() const {
00277         return elements[0];
00278     }
00279     
00280     T& back() {
00281         return elements[elementCount - 1];
00282     }
00283 
00284     const T & back() const {
00285         return elements[elementCount - 1];
00286     }
00287 
00288     sidx_t indexOf(T & t, std::idx_t idx = 0) const {
00289         for (std::size_t i = idx; i < size(); i++) {
00290             if (Equals(*this[i], t)) {
00291                 return i;
00292             }
00293         }
00294         return -1;
00295     }
00296 
00297     inline int lastIndexOf(const T & t) const {
00298         return lastIndexOf(t, elementCount);
00299     }
00300 
00301     sidx_t lastIndexOf(T & t, std::size_t idx) const {
00302         if (idx > size()) sthrow(ArrayException, "Vector out of bounds");
00303         for (std::size_t i = idx; i >= 0; i--) {
00304             if (Equals((*this)[i], t)) {
00305                 return i;
00306             }
00307         }
00308         return -1;
00309     }
00310 
00311     T & operator[](std::idx_t idx) {
00312         return get(idx);
00313     }
00314 
00315     const T & operator[](std::idx_t idx) const {
00316         return get(idx);
00317     }
00318 
00319     Vector<T> & operator=(const Vector<T> & rhs) const {
00320         delete elements;
00321         elements = Array<T>(rhs.elements.length);
00322         capacityIncrease = rhs.capacityIncrease;
00323         elementCount = rhs.elementCount;
00324         arraycopy(rhs.elements, 0, elements, 0, rhs.elements.length);
00325         return *this;
00326     }
00327 private:
00328     std::size_t elementCount;
00329     std::size_t capacityIncrease;
00330     Array<T> elements;
00331 
00332     void ensureCapacity(std::size_t capacity) {
00333         if (capacity <= elements->length) return;
00334         std::size_t newsize;
00335         if (capacityIncrease == 0) newsize = elements->length * 2;
00336         else newsize = elements->length + capacityIncrease;
00337         Array<T> oldElements = elements;
00338         elements = Array<T>(newsize);
00339         arraycopy(oldElements, 0, elements, 0, oldElements.length);
00340         delete oldElements;
00341     }
00342 };
00343 
00344 SYLPH_END_NAMESPACE
00345 #endif  /* VECTOR_H_ */
